pullRequest.title: [RW-4160][risk=no] Institution API+CRUD
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description:
Enable CRUD operations on new Institution entities for those with INSTITUTION_ADMIN Authority
See also the many comments on an earlier Draft of this PR at #3073

PR checklist

 This PR meets the Acceptance Criteria in the JIRA story
 The JIRA story has been moved to Dev Review
 This PR includes appropriate unit tests
 I have run and tested this change locally
 If this includes an API change, I have updated the appropriate Swagger definitions and notified API consumers
 If this includes a new feature flag, I have created and linked new JIRA tickets to (a) turn on the feature flag and (b) remove it later

commit.message:
Squash a day's worth of responses to review comments:

rename to dbId

convert to sets where possible

hashcode, equals, splatfix

test improvements and a bug fix

Make findOneByApiId Optional

longName -> displayNAme

remove unnecessary setters/getters

tighten the Swagger a bit

this doesn't need to be a provider

push NotFoundException up to Controller level

better pattern for nulls

silly NotNull

apiId -> shortName

updated organizationTypeOtherText description

use assertThat().isEmpty()

orElse

lint
TIL Controllers need to live in the api package for Spring to find them
TIL: All Controllers must be located in the `org.pmiops.workbench.api` package.

nodes.bodyText: For checking Optionals

nodes.bodyText: All of these are arbitrarily 80.  Your thoughts?

+    <createTable tableName="institution">
+      <column name="institution_id" type="bigint" autoIncrement="true">
+        <constraints primaryKey="true" nullable="false"/>
+      </column>
+      <column name="short_name" type="VARCHAR(80)">

nodes.bodyText: generated these because we use them in Sets
5 and 6 are unrelated to this PR: making educated guesses here, for completeness

   #      to perform actions on a user's enabled status and manual verification.
   #   4) FEATURED_WORKSPACE_ADMIN: Allows a user to publish workspaces

commit.message: Don't need INSTITUTION_ADMIN Authority for GET

nodes.bodyText: Nice, i typically always implement equals/hashcode for all jpa model objects, but sometimes object equality is enough.
I think we decided as a team to not use wildcards in import statements. Assuming your using Intellij? Setting for this.
Why are using Provider and not injecting the dao directly? Injecting the dao directly should be sufficient.
May want to use the saved Iterable here as well, before setting email domains below.
Another save here.
@DirtiesContext(classMode = DirtiesContext.ClassMode.BEFORE_EACH_TEST_METHOD)
@DirtiesContext(classMode = DirtiesContext.ClassMode.BEFORE_EACH_TEST_METHOD)
@DirtiesContext(classMode = DirtiesContext.ClassMode.BEFORE_EACH_TEST_METHOD)
If you don't have a test config you can just remove it and move the @Import({InstitutionServiceImpl.class}) under @DataJpaTest

commit.message: these don't need to be providers

use the saved object after saving in the DAO, not the original
lint

nodes.bodyText: Sorry.. i was meaning that you could remove these 2 if statements and replace with the return suggestion
Same here, you can remove these 2 if statements
